      31                 :            : // Author: kenton@google.com (Kenton Varda)
      32                 :            : //  Based on original Protocol Buffers design by
      33                 :            : //  Sanjay Ghemawat, Jeff Dean, and others.
      34                 :            : //
      35                 :            : // This file contains classes which describe a type of protocol message.
      36                 :            : // You can use a message's descriptor to learn at runtime what fields
      37                 :            : // it contains and what the types of those fields are.  The Message
      38                 :            : // interface also allows you to dynamically access and modify individual
      39                 :            : // fields by passing the FieldDescriptor of the field you are interested
      40                 :            : // in.
      41                 :            : //
      42                 :            : // Most users will not care about descriptors, because they will write
      43                 :            : // code specific to certain protocol types and will simply use the classes
      44                 :            : // generated by the protocol compiler directly.  Advanced users who want
      45                 :            : // to operate on arbitrary types (not known at compile time) may want to
      46                 :            : // read descriptors in order to learn about the contents of a message.
      47                 :            : // A very small number of users will want to construct their own
      48                 :            : // Descriptors, either because they are implementing Message manually or
      49                 :            : // because they are writing something like the protocol compiler.
      50                 :            : //
      51                 :            : // For an example of how you might use descriptors, see the code example
      52                 :            : // at the top of message.h.
      53                 :            : 
      54                 :            : #ifndef GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_DESCRIPTOR_H__
      55                 :            : #define GOOGLE_PROTOBUF_DESCRIPTOR_H__
      56                 :            : 
      57                 :            : #include <memory>
      58                 :            : #ifndef _SHARED_PTR_H
      59                 :            : #include <google/protobuf/stubs/shared_ptr.h>
      60                 :            : #endif
      61                 :            : #include <set>
      62                 :            : #include <string>
      63                 :            : #include <vector>
      64                 :            : #include <google/protobuf/stubs/common.h>
      65                 :            : #include <google/protobuf/stubs/mutex.h>
      66                 :            : #include <google/protobuf/stubs/once.h>
      67                 :            :

      69                 :            : #ifdef TYPE_BOOL
      70                 :            : #undef TYPE_BOOL
      71                 :            : #endif  // TYPE_BOOL

     139                 :            : struct SourceLocation {

     152                 :            : // Options when generating machine-parsable output from a descriptor with
     153                 :            : // DebugString().
     154                 :            : struct DebugStringOptions {
     155                 :            :   // include original user comments as recorded in SourceLocation entries. N.B.
     156                 :            :   // that this must be |false| by default: several other pieces of code (for
     157                 :            :   // example, the C++ code generation for fields in the proto compiler) rely on
     158                 :            :   // DebugString() output being unobstructed by user comments.
     159                 :            :   bool include_comments;
     160                 :            :   // If true, elide the braced body in the debug string.
     161                 :            :   bool elide_group_body;
     162                 :            :   bool elide_oneof_body;
     163                 :            : 
     164                 :            :   DebugStringOptions()
     165                 :            :       : include_comments(false),
     166                 :            :         elide_group_body(false),
     167                 :            :         elide_oneof_body(false) {}
     168                 :            : };
     169                 :            : 
     170                 :            : // A class to handle the simplest cases of a lazily linked descriptor
     171                 :            : // for a message type that isn't built at the time of cross linking,
     172                 :            : // which is needed when a pool has lazily_build_dependencies_ set.
     173                 :            : // Must be instantiated as mutable in a descriptor.
     174                 :            : namespace internal {
     175                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT LazyDescriptor {
     176                 :            :  public:
     177                 :            :   // Init function to be called at init time of a descriptor containing
     178                 :            :   // a LazyDescriptor.
     179                 :            :   void Init() {
     180                 :            :     descriptor_ = NULL;
     181                 :            :     name_ = NULL;
     182                 :            :     once_ = NULL;
     183                 :            :     file_ = NULL;
     184                 :            :   }
     185                 :            : 
     186                 :            :   // Sets the value of the descriptor if it is known during the descriptor
     187                 :            :   // building process. Not thread safe, should only be called during the
     188                 :            :   // descriptor build process. Should not be called after SetLazy has been
     189                 :            :   // called.
     190                 :            :   void Set(const Descriptor* descriptor);
     191                 :            : 
     192                 :            :   // Sets the information needed to lazily cross link the descriptor at a later
     193                 :            :   // time, SetLazy is not thread safe, should be called only once at descriptor
     194                 :            :   // build time if the symbol wasn't found and building of the file containing
     195                 :            :   // that type is delayed because lazily_build_dependencies_ is set on the pool.
     196                 :            :   // Should not be called after Set() has been called.
     197                 :            :   void SetLazy(const string& name, const FileDescriptor* file);
     198                 :            : 
     199                 :            :   // Returns the current value of the descriptor, thread-safe. If SetLazy(...)
     200                 :            :   // has been called, will do a one-time cross link of the type specified,
     201                 :            :   // building the descriptor file that contains the type if necessary.
     202                 :            :   inline const Descriptor* Get() {
     203                 :            :     Once();
     204                 :            :     return descriptor_;
     205                 :            :   }
     206                 :            : 
     207                 :            :  private:
     208                 :            :   static void OnceStatic(LazyDescriptor* lazy);
     209                 :            :   void OnceInternal();
     210                 :            :   void Once();
     211                 :            : 
     212                 :            :   const Descriptor* descriptor_;
     213                 :            :   const string* name_;
     214                 :            :   GoogleOnceDynamic* once_;
     215                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file_;
     216                 :            : };
     217                 :            : }  // namespace internal
     218                 :            : 
     219                 :            : // Describes a type of protocol message, or a particular group within a
     220                 :            : // message.  To obtain the Descriptor for a given message object, call
     221                 :            : // Message::GetDescriptor().  Generated message classes also have a
     222                 :            : // static method called descriptor() which returns the type's descriptor.
     223                 :            : // Use DescriptorPool to construct your own descriptors.
     224                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT Descriptor {
     225                 :            :  public:
     226                 :            :   // The name of the message type, not including its scope.
     227                 :            :   const string& name() const;
     228                 :            : 
     229                 :            :   // The fully-qualified name of the message type, scope delimited by
     230                 :            :   // periods.  For example, message type "Foo" which is declared in package
     231                 :            :   // "bar" has full name "bar.Foo".  If a type "Baz" is nested within
     232                 :            :   // Foo, Baz's full_name is "bar.Foo.Baz".  To get only the part that
     233                 :            :   // comes after the last '.', use name().
     234                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;
     235                 :            : 
     236                 :            :   // Index of this descriptor within the file or containing type's message
     237                 :            :   // type array.
     238                 :            :   int index() const;
     239                 :            : 
     240                 :            :   // The .proto file in which this message type was defined.  Never NULL.
     241                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file() const;
     242                 :            : 
     243                 :            :   // If this Descriptor describes a nested type, this returns the type
     244                 :            :   // in which it is nested.  Otherwise, returns NULL.
     245                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type() const;
     246                 :            : 
     247                 :            :   // Get options for this message type.  These are specified in the .proto file
     248                 :            :   // by placing lines like "option foo = 1234;" in the message definition.
     249                 :            :   // Allowed options are defined by MessageOptions in
     250                 :            :   // google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
     251                 :            :   // message.
     252                 :            :   const MessageOptions& options() const;
     253                 :            : 
     254                 :            :   // Write the contents of this Descriptor into the given DescriptorProto.
     255                 :            :   // The target DescriptorProto must be clear before calling this; if it
     256                 :            :   // isn't, the result may be garbage.
     257                 :            :   void CopyTo(DescriptorProto* proto) const;
     258                 :            : 
     259                 :            :   // Write the contents of this decriptor in a human-readable form. Output
     260                 :            :   // will be suitable for re-parsing.
     261                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
     262                 :            : 
     263                 :            :   // Similar to DebugString(), but additionally takes options (e.g.,
     264                 :            :   // include original user comments in output).
     265                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     266                 :            : 
     267                 :            :   // Returns true if this is a placeholder for an unknown type. This will
     268                 :            :   // only be the case if this descriptor comes from a DescriptorPool
     269                 :            :   // with AllowUnknownDependencies() set.
     270                 :            :   bool is_placeholder() const;
     271                 :            : 
     272                 :            :   // Field stuff -----------------------------------------------------
     273                 :            : 
     274                 :            :   // The number of fields in this message type.
     275                 :            :   int field_count() const;
     276                 :            :   // Gets a field by index, where 0 <= index < field_count().
     277                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     278                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* field(int index) const;
     279                 :            : 
     280                 :            :   // Looks up a field by declared tag number.  Returns NULL if no such field
     281                 :            :   // exists.
     282                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindFieldByNumber(int number) const;
     283                 :            :   // Looks up a field by name.  Returns NULL if no such field exists.
     284                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindFieldByName(const string& name) const;
     285                 :            : 
     286                 :            :   // Looks up a field by lowercased name (as returned by lowercase_name()).
     287                 :            :   // This lookup may be ambiguous if multiple field names differ only by case,
     288                 :            :   // in which case the field returned is chosen arbitrarily from the matches.
     289                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindFieldByLowercaseName(
     290                 :            :       const string& lowercase_name) const;
     291                 :            : 
     292                 :            :   // Looks up a field by camel-case name (as returned by camelcase_name()).
     293                 :            :   // This lookup may be ambiguous if multiple field names differ in a way that
     294                 :            :   // leads them to have identical camel-case names, in which case the field
     295                 :            :   // returned is chosen arbitrarily from the matches.
     296                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindFieldByCamelcaseName(
     297                 :            :       const string& camelcase_name) const;
     298                 :            : 
     299                 :            :   // The number of oneofs in this message type.
     300                 :            :   int oneof_decl_count() const;
     301                 :            :   // Get a oneof by index, where 0 <= index < oneof_decl_count().
     302                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     303                 :            :   const OneofDescriptor* oneof_decl(int index) const;
     304                 :            : 
     305                 :            :   // Looks up a oneof by name.  Returns NULL if no such oneof exists.
     306                 :            :   const OneofDescriptor* FindOneofByName(const string& name) const;
     307                 :            : 
     308                 :            :   // Nested type stuff -----------------------------------------------
     309                 :            : 
     310                 :            :   // The number of nested types in this message type.
     311                 :            :   int nested_type_count() const;
     312                 :            :   // Gets a nested type by index, where 0 <= index < nested_type_count().
     313                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     314                 :            :   const Descriptor* nested_type(int index) const;
     315                 :            : 
     316                 :            :   // Looks up a nested type by name.  Returns NULL if no such nested type
     317                 :            :   // exists.
     318                 :            :   const Descriptor* FindNestedTypeByName(const string& name) const;
     319                 :            : 
     320                 :            :   // Enum stuff ------------------------------------------------------
     321                 :            : 
     322                 :            :   // The number of enum types in this message type.
     323                 :            :   int enum_type_count() const;
     324                 :            :   // Gets an enum type by index, where 0 <= index < enum_type_count().
     325                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     326                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* enum_type(int index) const;
     327                 :            : 
     328                 :            :   // Looks up an enum type by name.  Returns NULL if no such enum type exists.
     329                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* FindEnumTypeByName(const string& name) const;
     330                 :            : 
     331                 :            :   // Looks up an enum value by name, among all enum types in this message.
     332                 :            :   // Returns NULL if no such value exists.
     333                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* FindEnumValueByName(const string& name) const;
     334                 :            : 
     335                 :            :   // Extensions ------------------------------------------------------
     336                 :            : 
     337                 :            :   // A range of field numbers which are designated for third-party
     338                 :            :   // extensions.
     339                 :            :   struct ExtensionRange {
     340                 :            :     int start;  // inclusive
     341                 :            :     int end;    // exclusive
     342                 :            :   };
     343                 :            : 
     344                 :            :   // The number of extension ranges in this message type.
     345                 :            :   int extension_range_count() const;
     346                 :            :   // Gets an extension range by index, where 0 <= index <
     347                 :            :   // extension_range_count(). These are returned in the order they were defined
     348                 :            :   // in the .proto file.
     349                 :            :   const ExtensionRange* extension_range(int index) const;
     350                 :            : 
     351                 :            :   // Returns true if the number is in one of the extension ranges.
     352                 :            :   bool IsExtensionNumber(int number) const;
     353                 :            : 
     354                 :            :   // Returns NULL if no extension range contains the given number.
     355                 :            :   const ExtensionRange* FindExtensionRangeContainingNumber(int number) const;
     356                 :            : 
     357                 :            :   // The number of extensions -- extending *other* messages -- that were
     358                 :            :   // defined nested within this message type's scope.
     359                 :            :   int extension_count() const;
     360                 :            :   // Get an extension by index, where 0 <= index < extension_count().
     361                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     362                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* extension(int index) const;
     363                 :            : 
     364                 :            :   // Looks up a named extension (which extends some *other* message type)
     365                 :            :   // defined within this message type's scope.
     366                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByName(const string& name) const;
     367                 :            : 
     368                 :            :   // Similar to FindFieldByLowercaseName(), but finds extensions defined within
     369                 :            :   // this message type's scope.
     370                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByLowercaseName(const string& name) const;
     371                 :            : 
     372                 :            :   // Similar to FindFieldByCamelcaseName(), but finds extensions defined within
     373                 :            :   // this message type's scope.
     374                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByCamelcaseName(const string& name) const;
     375                 :            : 
     376                 :            :   // Reserved fields -------------------------------------------------
     377                 :            : 
     378                 :            :   // A range of reserved field numbers.
     379                 :            :   struct ReservedRange {
     380                 :            :     int start;  // inclusive
     381                 :            :     int end;    // exclusive
     382                 :            :   };
     383                 :            : 
     384                 :            :   // The number of reserved ranges in this message type.
     385                 :            :   int reserved_range_count() const;
     386                 :            :   // Gets an reserved range by index, where 0 <= index <
     387                 :            :   // reserved_range_count(). These are returned in the order they were defined
     388                 :            :   // in the .proto file.
     389                 :            :   const ReservedRange* reserved_range(int index) const;
     390                 :            : 
     391                 :            :   // Returns true if the number is in one of the reserved ranges.
     392                 :            :   bool IsReservedNumber(int number) const;
     393                 :            : 
     394                 :            :   // Returns NULL if no reserved range contains the given number.
     395                 :            :   const ReservedRange* FindReservedRangeContainingNumber(int number) const;
     396                 :            : 
     397                 :            :   // The number of reserved field names in this message type.
     398                 :            :   int reserved_name_count() const;
     399                 :            :

     401                 :            :   const string& reserved_name(int index) const;
     402                 :            : 
     403                 :            :   // Returns true if the field name is reserved.

     406                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
     407                 :            : 
     408                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete

     410                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
     411                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
     412                 :            : 
     413                 :            :  private:
     414                 :            :   typedef MessageOptions OptionsType;

     479                 :            : 
     480                 :            : // Describes a single field of a message.  To get the descriptor for a given
     481                 :            : // field, first get the Descriptor for the message in which it is defined,
     482                 :            : // then call Descriptor::FindFieldByName().  To get a FieldDescriptor for
     483                 :            : // an extension, do one of the following:
     484                 :            : // - Get the Descriptor or FileDescriptor for its containing scope, then
     485                 :            : //   call Descriptor::FindExtensionByName() or
     486                 :            : //   FileDescriptor::FindExtensionByName().
     487                 :            : // - Given a DescriptorPool, call DescriptorPool::FindExtensionByNumber().
     488                 :            : // - Given a Reflection for a message object, call
     489                 :            : //   Reflection::FindKnownExtensionByName() or
     490                 :            : //   Reflection::FindKnownExtensionByNumber().
     491                 :            : // Use DescriptorPool to construct your own descriptors.
     492                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT FieldDescriptor {
     493                 :            :  public:
     494                 :            :   // Identifies a field type.  0 is reserved for errors.  The order is weird
     495                 :            :   // for historical reasons.  Types 12 and up are new in proto2.
     496                 :            :   enum Type {
     497                 :            :     TYPE_DOUBLE         = 1,   // double, exactly eight bytes on the wire.
     498                 :            :     TYPE_FLOAT          = 2,   // float, exactly four bytes on the wire.
     499                 :            :     TYPE_INT64          = 3,   // int64, varint on the wire.  Negative numbers
     500                 :            :                                // take 10 bytes.  Use TYPE_SINT64 if negative
     501                 :            :                                // values are likely.
     502                 :            :     TYPE_UINT64         = 4,   // uint64, varint on the wire.
     503                 :            :     TYPE_INT32          = 5,   // int32, varint on the wire.  Negative numbers
     504                 :            :                                // take 10 bytes.  Use TYPE_SINT32 if negative
     505                 :            :                                // values are likely.
     506                 :            :     TYPE_FIXED64        = 6,   // uint64, exactly eight bytes on the wire.
     507                 :            :     TYPE_FIXED32        = 7,   // uint32, exactly four bytes on the wire.
     508                 :            :     TYPE_BOOL           = 8,   // bool, varint on the wire.
     509                 :            :     TYPE_STRING         = 9,   // UTF-8 text.
     510                 :            :     TYPE_GROUP          = 10,  // Tag-delimited message.  Deprecated.
     511                 :            :     TYPE_MESSAGE        = 11,  // Length-delimited message.
     512                 :            : 
     513                 :            :     TYPE_BYTES          = 12,  // Arbitrary byte array.
     514                 :            :     TYPE_UINT32         = 13,  // uint32, varint on the wire
     515                 :            :     TYPE_ENUM           = 14,  // Enum, varint on the wire
     516                 :            :     TYPE_SFIXED32       = 15,  // int32, exactly four bytes on the wire
     517                 :            :     TYPE_SFIXED64       = 16,  // int64, exactly eight bytes on the wire
     518                 :            :     TYPE_SINT32         = 17,  // int32, ZigZag-encoded varint on the wire
     519                 :            :     TYPE_SINT64         = 18,  // int64, ZigZag-encoded varint on the wire
     520                 :            : 
     521                 :            :     MAX_TYPE            = 18,  // Constant useful for defining lookup tables
     522                 :            :                                // indexed by Type.
     523                 :            :   };
     524                 :            : 
     525                 :            :   // Specifies the C++ data type used to represent the field.  There is a
     526                 :            :   // fixed mapping from Type to CppType where each Type maps to exactly one
     527                 :            :   // CppType.  0 is reserved for errors.
     528                 :            :   enum CppType {
     529                 :            :     CPPTYPE_INT32       = 1,     // TYPE_INT32, TYPE_SINT32, TYPE_SFIXED32
     530                 :            :     CPPTYPE_INT64       = 2,     // TYPE_INT64, TYPE_SINT64, TYPE_SFIXED64
     531                 :            :     CPPTYPE_UINT32      = 3,     // TYPE_UINT32, TYPE_FIXED32
     532                 :            :     CPPTYPE_UINT64      = 4,     // TYPE_UINT64, TYPE_FIXED64
     533                 :            :     CPPTYPE_DOUBLE      = 5,     // TYPE_DOUBLE
     534                 :            :     CPPTYPE_FLOAT       = 6,     // TYPE_FLOAT
     535                 :            :     CPPTYPE_BOOL        = 7,     // TYPE_BOOL
     536                 :            :     CPPTYPE_ENUM        = 8,     // TYPE_ENUM
     537                 :            :     CPPTYPE_STRING      = 9,     // TYPE_STRING, TYPE_BYTES
     538                 :            :     CPPTYPE_MESSAGE     = 10,    // TYPE_MESSAGE, TYPE_GROUP
     539                 :            : 
     540                 :            :     MAX_CPPTYPE         = 10,    // Constant useful for defining lookup tables
     541                 :            :                                  // indexed by CppType.
     542                 :            :   };
     543                 :            : 
     544                 :            :   // Identifies whether the field is optional, required, or repeated.  0 is
     545                 :            :   // reserved for errors.
     546                 :            :   enum Label {
     547                 :            :     LABEL_OPTIONAL      = 1,    // optional
     548                 :            :     LABEL_REQUIRED      = 2,    // required
     549                 :            :     LABEL_REPEATED      = 3,    // repeated
     550                 :            : 
     551                 :            :     MAX_LABEL           = 3,    // Constant useful for defining lookup tables
     552                 :            :                                 // indexed by Label.
     553                 :            :   };
     554                 :            : 
     555                 :            :   // Valid field numbers are positive integers up to kMaxNumber.
     556                 :            :   static const int kMaxNumber = (1 << 29) - 1;
     557                 :            : 
     558                 :            :   // First field number reserved for the protocol buffer library implementation.
     559                 :            :   // Users may not declare fields that use reserved numbers.
     560                 :            :   static const int kFirstReservedNumber = 19000;
     561                 :            :   // Last field number reserved for the protocol buffer library implementation.
     562                 :            :   // Users may not declare fields that use reserved numbers.
     563                 :            :   static const int kLastReservedNumber  = 19999;
     564                 :            : 
     565                 :            :   const string& name() const;        // Name of this field within the message.
     566                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;   // Fully-qualified name of the field.
     567                 :            :   const string& json_name() const;   // JSON name of this field.
     568                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file() const;// File in which this field was defined.
     569                 :            :   bool is_extension() const;         // Is this an extension field?
     570                 :            :   int number() const;                // Declared tag number.
     571                 :            : 
     572                 :            :   // Same as name() except converted to lower-case.  This (and especially the
     573                 :            :   // FindFieldByLowercaseName() method) can be useful when parsing formats
     574                 :            :   // which prefer to use lowercase naming style.  (Although, technically
     575                 :            :   // field names should be lowercased anyway according to the protobuf style
     576                 :            :   // guide, so this only makes a difference when dealing with old .proto files
     577                 :            :   // which do not follow the guide.)
     578                 :            :   const string& lowercase_name() const;
     579                 :            : 
     580                 :            :   // Same as name() except converted to camel-case.  In this conversion, any
     581                 :            :   // time an underscore appears in the name, it is removed and the next
     582                 :            :   // letter is capitalized.  Furthermore, the first letter of the name is
     583                 :            :   // lower-cased.  Examples:
     584                 :            :   //   FooBar -> fooBar
     585                 :            :   //   foo_bar -> fooBar
     586                 :            :   //   fooBar -> fooBar
     587                 :            :   // This (and especially the FindFieldByCamelcaseName() method) can be useful
     588                 :            :   // when parsing formats which prefer to use camel-case naming style.
     589                 :            :   const string& camelcase_name() const;
     590                 :            : 
     591                 :            :   Type type() const;                  // Declared type of this field.
     592                 :            :   const char* type_name() const;      // Name of the declared type.
     593                 :            :   CppType cpp_type() const;           // C++ type of this field.
     594                 :            :   const char* cpp_type_name() const;  // Name of the C++ type.
     595                 :            :   Label label() const;                // optional/required/repeated
     596                 :            : 
     597                 :            :   bool is_required() const;      // shorthand for label() == LABEL_REQUIRED
     598                 :            :   bool is_optional() const;      // shorthand for label() == LABEL_OPTIONAL
     599                 :            :   bool is_repeated() const;      // shorthand for label() == LABEL_REPEATED
     600                 :            :   bool is_packable() const;      // shorthand for is_repeated() &&
     601                 :            :                                  //               IsTypePackable(type())
     602                 :            :   bool is_packed() const;        // shorthand for is_packable() &&
     603                 :            :                                  //               options().packed()
     604                 :            :   bool is_map() const;           // shorthand for type() == TYPE_MESSAGE &&
     605                 :            :                                  // message_type()->options().map_entry()
     606                 :            : 
     607                 :            :   // Index of this field within the message's field array, or the file or
     608                 :            :   // extension scope's extensions array.
     609                 :            :   int index() const;
     610                 :            : 
     611                 :            :   // Does this field have an explicitly-declared default value?
     612                 :            :   bool has_default_value() const;
     613                 :            : 
     614                 :            :   // Whether the user has specified the json_name field option in the .proto
     615                 :            :   // file.
     616                 :            :   bool has_json_name() const;
     617                 :            : 
     618                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_INT32.  If no
     619                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.
     620                 :            :   int32 default_value_int32() const;
     621                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_INT64.  If no
     622                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.
     623                 :            :   int64 default_value_int64() const;
     624                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_UINT32.  If no
     625                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.
     626                 :            :   uint32 default_value_uint32() const;
     627                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_UINT64.  If no
     628                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.
     629                 :            :   uint64 default_value_uint64() const;
     630                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_FLOAT.  If no
     631                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.0.
     632                 :            :   float default_value_float() const;
     633                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_DOUBLE.  If no
     634                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is 0.0.
     635                 :            :   double default_value_double() const;
     636                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_BOOL.  If no
     637                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is false.
     638                 :            :   bool default_value_bool() const;
     639                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_ENUM.  If no
     640                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is the first value defined
     641                 :            :   // in the enum type (all enum types are required to have at least one value).
     642                 :            :   // This never returns NULL.
     643                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* default_value_enum() const;
     644                 :            :   // Get the field default value if cpp_type() == CPPTYPE_STRING.  If no
     645                 :            :   // explicit default was defined, the default is the empty string.
     646                 :            :   const string& default_value_string() const;
     647                 :            : 
     648                 :            :   // The Descriptor for the message of which this is a field.  For extensions,
     649                 :            :   // this is the extended type.  Never NULL.
     650                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type() const;
     651                 :            : 
     652                 :            :   // If the field is a member of a oneof, this is the one, otherwise this is
     653                 :            :   // NULL.
     654                 :            :   const OneofDescriptor* containing_oneof() const;
     655                 :            : 
     656                 :            :   // If the field is a member of a oneof, returns the index in that oneof.
     657                 :            :   int index_in_oneof() const;
     658                 :            : 
     659                 :            :   // An extension may be declared within the scope of another message.  If this
     660                 :            :   // field is an extension (is_extension() is true), then extension_scope()
     661                 :            :   // returns that message, or NULL if the extension was declared at global
     662                 :            :   // scope.  If this is not an extension, extension_scope() is undefined (may
     663                 :            :   // assert-fail).
     664                 :            :   const Descriptor* extension_scope() const;
     665                 :            : 
     666                 :            :   // If type is TYPE_MESSAGE or TYPE_GROUP, returns a descriptor for the
     667                 :            :   // message or the group type.  Otherwise, returns null.
     668                 :            :   const Descriptor* message_type() const;
     669                 :            :   // If type is TYPE_ENUM, returns a descriptor for the enum.  Otherwise,
     670                 :            :   // returns null.
     671                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* enum_type() const;
     672                 :            : 
     673                 :            :   // Get the FieldOptions for this field.  This includes things listed in
     674                 :            :   // square brackets after the field definition.  E.g., the field:
     675                 :            :   //   optional string text = 1 [ctype=CORD];
     676                 :            :   // has the "ctype" option set.  Allowed options are defined by FieldOptions
     677                 :            :   // in google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
     678                 :            :   // message.
     679                 :            :   const FieldOptions& options() const;
     680                 :            : 
     681                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
     682                 :            :   void CopyTo(FieldDescriptorProto* proto) const;
     683                 :            : 
     684                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     685                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
     686                 :            : 
     687                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
     688                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     689                 :            : 
     690                 :            :   // Helper method to get the CppType for a particular Type.
     691                 :            :   static CppType TypeToCppType(Type type);
     692                 :            : 
     693                 :            :   // Helper method to get the name of a Type.
     694                 :            :   static const char* TypeName(Type type);
     695                 :            : 
     696                 :            :   // Helper method to get the name of a CppType.
     697                 :            :   static const char* CppTypeName(CppType cpp_type);
     698                 :            : 
     699                 :            :   // Return true iff [packed = true] is valid for fields of this type.
     700                 :            :   static inline bool IsTypePackable(Type field_type);
     701                 :            : 
     702                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
     703                 :            : 
     704                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
     705                 :            :   // extent of this field declaration.  Returns false and leaves
     706                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
     707                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
     708                 :            : 
     709                 :            :  private:
     710                 :            :   typedef FieldOptions OptionsType;
     711                 :            : 
     712                 :            :   // Allows access to GetLocationPath for annotations.
     713                 :            :   friend class ::google::protobuf::io::Printer;
     714                 :            : 
     715                 :            :   // Fill the json_name field of FieldDescriptorProto.
     716                 :            :   void CopyJsonNameTo(FieldDescriptorProto* proto) const;
     717                 :            : 
     718                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     719                 :            :   enum PrintLabelFlag { PRINT_LABEL, OMIT_LABEL };
     720                 :            :   void DebugString(int depth, PrintLabelFlag print_label_flag,
     721                 :            :                    string* contents, const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     722                 :            : 
     723                 :            :   // formats the default value appropriately and returns it as a string.
     724                 :            :   // Must have a default value to call this. If quote_string_type is true, then
     725                 :            :   // types of CPPTYPE_STRING whill be surrounded by quotes and CEscaped.
     726                 :            :   string DefaultValueAsString(bool quote_string_type) const;
     727                 :            : 
     728                 :            :   // Helper function that returns the field type name for DebugString.
     729                 :            :   string FieldTypeNameDebugString() const;
     730                 :            : 
     731                 :            :   // Walks up the descriptor tree to generate the source location path
     732                 :            :   // to this descriptor from the file root.
     733                 :            :   void GetLocationPath(std::vector<int>* output) const;
     734                 :            : 
     735                 :            :   const string* name_;
     736                 :            :   const string* full_name_;
     737                 :            :   const string* lowercase_name_;
     738                 :            :   const string* camelcase_name_;
     739                 :            :   // Whether the user has specified the json_name field option in the .proto
     740                 :            :   // file.
     741                 :            :   bool has_json_name_;
     742                 :            :   // If has_json_name_ is true, it's the value specified by the user.
     743                 :            :   // Otherwise, it has the same value as camelcase_name_.
     744                 :            :   const string* json_name_;
     745                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file_;
     746                 :            :   int number_;
     747                 :            :   GoogleOnceDynamic* type_once_;
     748                 :            :   static void TypeOnceInit(const FieldDescriptor* to_init);
     749                 :            :   void InternalTypeOnceInit() const;
     750                 :            :   mutable Type type_;
     751                 :            :   Label label_;
     752                 :            :   bool is_extension_;
     753                 :            :   int index_in_oneof_;
     754                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type_;
     755                 :            :   const OneofDescriptor* containing_oneof_;
     756                 :            :   const Descriptor* extension_scope_;
     757                 :            :   mutable const Descriptor* message_type_;
     758                 :            :   mutable const EnumDescriptor* enum_type_;
     759                 :            :   const FieldOptions* options_;
     760                 :            :   const string* type_name_;
     761                 :            :   const string* default_value_enum_name_;
     762                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
     763                 :            :   // of Allocate<FieldDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<FieldDescriptor>() in
     764                 :            :   // descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
     765                 :            : 
     766                 :            :   bool has_default_value_;
     767                 :            :   union {
     768                 :            :     int32  default_value_int32_;
     769                 :            :     int64  default_value_int64_;
     770                 :            :     uint32 default_value_uint32_;
     771                 :            :     uint64 default_value_uint64_;
     772                 :            :     float  default_value_float_;
     773                 :            :     double default_value_double_;
     774                 :            :     bool   default_value_bool_;
     775                 :            : 
     776                 :            :     mutable const EnumValueDescriptor* default_value_enum_;
     777                 :            :     const string* default_value_string_;
     778                 :            :   };
     779                 :            : 
     780                 :            :   static const CppType kTypeToCppTypeMap[MAX_TYPE + 1];
     781                 :            : 
     782                 :            :   static const char * const kTypeToName[MAX_TYPE + 1];
     783                 :            : 
     784                 :            :   static const char * const kCppTypeToName[MAX_CPPTYPE + 1];
     785                 :            : 
     786                 :            :   static const char * const kLabelToName[MAX_LABEL + 1];
     787                 :            : 
     788                 :            :   // Must be constructed using DescriptorPool.
     789                 :            :   FieldDescriptor() {}
     790                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
     791                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptor;
     792                 :            :   friend class Descriptor;
     793                 :            :   friend class OneofDescriptor;
     794                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(FieldDescriptor);
     795                 :            : };
     796                 :            : 
     797                 :            : // Describes a oneof defined in a message type.
     798                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT OneofDescriptor {
     799                 :            :  public:
     800                 :            :   const string& name() const;       // Name of this oneof.
     801                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;  // Fully-qualified name of the oneof.
     802                 :            : 
     803                 :            :   // Index of this oneof within the message's oneof array.
     804                 :            :   int index() const;
     805                 :            : 
     806                 :            :   // The Descriptor for the message containing this oneof.
     807                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type() const;
     808                 :            : 
     809                 :            :   // The number of (non-extension) fields which are members of this oneof.
     810                 :            :   int field_count() const;
     811                 :            :   // Get a member of this oneof, in the order in which they were declared in the
     812                 :            :   // .proto file.  Does not include extensions.
     813                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* field(int index) const;
     814                 :            : 
     815                 :            :   const OneofOptions& options() const;
     816                 :            : 
     817                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
     818                 :            :   void CopyTo(OneofDescriptorProto* proto) const;
     819                 :            : 
     820                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     821                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
     822                 :            : 
     823                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
     824                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     825                 :            : 
     826                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
     827                 :            : 
     828                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
     829                 :            :   // extent of this oneof declaration.  Returns false and leaves
     830                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
     831                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
     832                 :            : 
     833                 :            :  private:
     834                 :            :   typedef OneofOptions OptionsType;
     835                 :            : 
     836                 :            :   // Allows access to GetLocationPath for annotations.
     837                 :            :   friend class ::google::protobuf::io::Printer;
     838                 :            : 
     839                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     840                 :            :   void DebugString(int depth, string* contents,
     841                 :            :                    const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     842                 :            : 
     843                 :            :   // Walks up the descriptor tree to generate the source location path
     844                 :            :   // to this descriptor from the file root.
     845                 :            :   void GetLocationPath(std::vector<int>* output) const;
     846                 :            : 
     847                 :            :   const string* name_;
     848                 :            :   const string* full_name_;
     849                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type_;
     850                 :            :   bool is_extendable_;
     851                 :            :   int field_count_;
     852                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor** fields_;
     853                 :            :   const OneofOptions* options_;
     854                 :            : 
     855                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
     856                 :            :   // of Allocate<OneofDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<OneofDescriptor>()
     857                 :            :   // in descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
     858                 :            : 
     859                 :            :   // Must be constructed using DescriptorPool.
     860                 :            :   OneofDescriptor() {}
     861                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
     862                 :            :   friend class Descriptor;
     863                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(OneofDescriptor);
     864                 :            : };
     865                 :            : 
     866                 :            : // Describes an enum type defined in a .proto file.  To get the EnumDescriptor
     867                 :            : // for a generated enum type, call TypeName_descriptor().  Use DescriptorPool
     868                 :            : // to construct your own descriptors.
     869                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT EnumDescriptor {
     870                 :            :  public:
     871                 :            :   // The name of this enum type in the containing scope.
     872                 :            :   const string& name() const;
     873                 :            : 
     874                 :            :   // The fully-qualified name of the enum type, scope delimited by periods.
     875                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;
     876                 :            : 
     877                 :            :   // Index of this enum within the file or containing message's enum array.
     878                 :            :   int index() const;
     879                 :            : 
     880                 :            :   // The .proto file in which this enum type was defined.  Never NULL.
     881                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file() const;
     882                 :            : 
     883                 :            :   // The number of values for this EnumDescriptor.  Guaranteed to be greater
     884                 :            :   // than zero.
     885                 :            :   int value_count() const;
     886                 :            :   // Gets a value by index, where 0 <= index < value_count().
     887                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
     888                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* value(int index) const;
     889                 :            : 
     890                 :            :   // Looks up a value by name.  Returns NULL if no such value exists.
     891                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* FindValueByName(const string& name) const;
     892                 :            :   // Looks up a value by number.  Returns NULL if no such value exists.  If
     893                 :            :   // multiple values have this number, the first one defined is returned.
     894                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* FindValueByNumber(int number) const;
     895                 :            : 
     896                 :            :   // If this enum type is nested in a message type, this is that message type.
     897                 :            :   // Otherwise, NULL.
     898                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type() const;
     899                 :            : 
     900                 :            :   // Get options for this enum type.  These are specified in the .proto file by
     901                 :            :   // placing lines like "option foo = 1234;" in the enum definition.  Allowed
     902                 :            :   // options are defined by EnumOptions in google/protobuf/descriptor.proto,
     903                 :            :   // and any available extensions of that message.
     904                 :            :   const EnumOptions& options() const;
     905                 :            : 
     906                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
     907                 :            :   void CopyTo(EnumDescriptorProto* proto) const;
     908                 :            : 
     909                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     910                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
     911                 :            : 
     912                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
     913                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     914                 :            : 
     915                 :            : 
     916                 :            :   // Returns true if this is a placeholder for an unknown enum. This will
     917                 :            :   // only be the case if this descriptor comes from a DescriptorPool
     918                 :            :   // with AllowUnknownDependencies() set.
     919                 :            :   bool is_placeholder() const;
     920                 :            : 
     921                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
     922                 :            : 
     923                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
     924                 :            :   // extent of this enum declaration.  Returns false and leaves
     925                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
     926                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
     927                 :            : 
     928                 :            :  private:
     929                 :            :   typedef EnumOptions OptionsType;
     930                 :            : 
     931                 :            :   // Allows access to GetLocationPath for annotations.
     932                 :            :   friend class ::google::protobuf::io::Printer;
     933                 :            : 
     934                 :            :   // Looks up a value by number.  If the value does not exist, dynamically
     935                 :            :   // creates a new EnumValueDescriptor for that value, assuming that it was
     936                 :            :   // unknown. If a new descriptor is created, this is done in a thread-safe way,
     937                 :            :   // and future calls will return the same value descriptor pointer.
     938                 :            :   //
     939                 :            :   // This is private but is used by GeneratedMessageReflection (which is
     940                 :            :   // friended below) to return a valid EnumValueDescriptor from GetEnum() when
     941                 :            :   // this feature is enabled.
     942                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor*
     943                 :            :       FindValueByNumberCreatingIfUnknown(int number) const;
     944                 :            : 
     945                 :            : 
     946                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
     947                 :            :   void DebugString(int depth, string *contents,
     948                 :            :                    const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
     949                 :            : 
     950                 :            :   // Walks up the descriptor tree to generate the source location path
     951                 :            :   // to this descriptor from the file root.
     952                 :            :   void GetLocationPath(std::vector<int>* output) const;
     953                 :            : 
     954                 :            :   const string* name_;
     955                 :            :   const string* full_name_;
     956                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file_;
     957                 :            :   const Descriptor* containing_type_;
     958                 :            :   const EnumOptions* options_;
     959                 :            : 
     960                 :            :   // True if this is a placeholder for an unknown type.
     961                 :            :   bool is_placeholder_;
     962                 :            :   // True if this is a placeholder and the type name wasn't fully-qualified.
     963                 :            :   bool is_unqualified_placeholder_;
     964                 :            : 
     965                 :            :   int value_count_;
     966                 :            :   EnumValueDescriptor* values_;
     967                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
     968                 :            :   // of Allocate<EnumDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<EnumDescriptor>() in
     969                 :            :   // descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
     970                 :            : 
     971                 :            :   // Must be constructed using DescriptorPool.
     972                 :            :   EnumDescriptor() {}
     973                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
     974                 :            :   friend class Descriptor;
     975                 :            :   friend class FieldDescriptor;
     976                 :            :   friend class EnumValueDescriptor;
     977                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptor;
     978                 :            :   friend class DescriptorPool;
     979                 :            :   friend class internal::GeneratedMessageReflection;
     980                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(EnumDescriptor);
     981                 :            : };
     982                 :            : 
     983                 :            : // Describes an individual enum constant of a particular type.  To get the
     984                 :            : // EnumValueDescriptor for a given enum value, first get the EnumDescriptor
     985                 :            : // for its type, then use EnumDescriptor::FindValueByName() or
     986                 :            : // EnumDescriptor::FindValueByNumber().  Use DescriptorPool to construct
     987                 :            : // your own descriptors.
     988                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT EnumValueDescriptor {
     989                 :            :  public:
     990                 :            :   const string& name() const;  // Name of this enum constant.
     991                 :            :   int index() const;           // Index within the enums's Descriptor.
     992                 :            :   int number() const;          // Numeric value of this enum constant.
     993                 :            : 
     994                 :            :   // The full_name of an enum value is a sibling symbol of the enum type.
     995                 :            :   // e.g. the full name of FieldDescriptorProto::TYPE_INT32 is actually
     996                 :            :   // "google.protobuf.FieldDescriptorProto.TYPE_INT32", NOT
     997                 :            :   // "google.protobuf.FieldDescriptorProto.Type.TYPE_INT32".  This is to conform
     998                 :            :   // with C++ scoping rules for enums.
     999                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;
    1000                 :            : 
    1001                 :            :   // The type of this value.  Never NULL.
    1002                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* type() const;
    1003                 :            : 
    1004                 :            :   // Get options for this enum value.  These are specified in the .proto file
    1005                 :            :   // by adding text like "[foo = 1234]" after an enum value definition.
    1006                 :            :   // Allowed options are defined by EnumValueOptions in
    1007                 :            :   // google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
    1008                 :            :   // message.
    1009                 :            :   const EnumValueOptions& options() const;
    1010                 :            : 
    1011                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
    1012                 :            :   void CopyTo(EnumValueDescriptorProto* proto) const;
    1013                 :            : 
    1014                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1015                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
    1016                 :            : 
    1017                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
    1018                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1019                 :            : 
    1020                 :            : 
    1021                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
    1022                 :            : 
    1023                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
    1024                 :            :   // extent of this enum value declaration.  Returns false and leaves
    1025                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
    1026                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
    1027                 :            : 
    1028                 :            :  private:
    1029                 :            :   typedef EnumValueOptions OptionsType;
    1030                 :            : 
    1031                 :            :   // Allows access to GetLocationPath for annotations.
    1032                 :            :   friend class ::google::protobuf::io::Printer;
    1033                 :            : 
    1034                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1035                 :            :   void DebugString(int depth, string *contents,
    1036                 :            :                    const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1037                 :            : 
    1038                 :            :   // Walks up the descriptor tree to generate the source location path
    1039                 :            :   // to this descriptor from the file root.
    1040                 :            :   void GetLocationPath(std::vector<int>* output) const;
    1041                 :            : 
    1042                 :            :   const string* name_;
    1043                 :            :   const string* full_name_;
    1044                 :            :   int number_;
    1045                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* type_;
    1046                 :            :   const EnumValueOptions* options_;
    1047                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
    1048                 :            :   // of Allocate<EnumValueDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<EnumValueDescriptor>()
    1049                 :            :   // in descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
    1050                 :            : 
    1051                 :            :   // Must be constructed using DescriptorPool.
    1052                 :            :   EnumValueDescriptor() {}
    1053                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
    1054                 :            :   friend class EnumDescriptor;
    1055                 :            :   friend class DescriptorPool;
    1056                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptorTables;
    1057                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(EnumValueDescriptor);
    1058                 :            : };
    1059                 :            : 
    1060                 :            : // Describes an RPC service.  To get the ServiceDescriptor for a service,
    1061                 :            : // call Service::GetDescriptor().  Generated service classes also have a
    1062                 :            : // static method called descriptor() which returns the type's
    1063                 :            : // ServiceDescriptor.  Use DescriptorPool to construct your own descriptors.
    1064                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT ServiceDescriptor {
    1065                 :            :  public:
    1066                 :            :   // The name of the service, not including its containing scope.
    1067                 :            :   const string& name() const;
    1068                 :            :   // The fully-qualified name of the service, scope delimited by periods.
    1069                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;
    1070                 :            :   // Index of this service within the file's services array.
    1071                 :            :   int index() const;
    1072                 :            : 
    1073                 :            :   // The .proto file in which this service was defined.  Never NULL.
    1074                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file() const;
    1075                 :            : 
    1076                 :            :   // Get options for this service type.  These are specified in the .proto file
    1077                 :            :   // by placing lines like "option foo = 1234;" in the service definition.
    1078                 :            :   // Allowed options are defined by ServiceOptions in
    1079                 :            :   // google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
    1080                 :            :   // message.
    1081                 :            :   const ServiceOptions& options() const;
    1082                 :            : 
    1083                 :            :   // The number of methods this service defines.
    1084                 :            :   int method_count() const;
    1085                 :            :   // Gets a MethodDescriptor by index, where 0 <= index < method_count().
    1086                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1087                 :            :   const MethodDescriptor* method(int index) const;
    1088                 :            : 
    1089                 :            :   // Look up a MethodDescriptor by name.
    1090                 :            :   const MethodDescriptor* FindMethodByName(const string& name) const;
    1091                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
    1092                 :            :   void CopyTo(ServiceDescriptorProto* proto) const;
    1093                 :            : 
    1094                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1095                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
    1096                 :            : 
    1097                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
    1098                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1099                 :            : 
    1100                 :            : 
    1101                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------
    1102                 :            : 
    1103                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
    1104                 :            :   // extent of this service declaration.  Returns false and leaves
    1105                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.
    1106                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;

    1110                 :            :

    1112                 :            :   friend class ::google::protobuf::io::Printer;
    1113                 :            : 
    1114                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1115                 :            :   void DebugString(string *contents, const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1116                 :            : 
    1117                 :            :   // Walks up the descriptor tree to generate the source location path
    1118                 :            :   // to this descriptor from the file root.
    1119                 :            :   void GetLocationPath(std::vector<int>* output) const;
    1120                 :            : 
    1121                 :            :   const string* name_;
    1122                 :            :   const string* full_name_;
    1123                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* file_;
    1124                 :            :   const ServiceOptions* options_;
    1125                 :            :   int method_count_;
    1126                 :            :   MethodDescriptor* methods_;
    1127                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
    1128                 :            :   // of Allocate<ServiceDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<ServiceDescriptor>() in
    1129                 :            :   // descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
    1130                 :            :

    1132                 :            :   ServiceDescriptor() {}

    1134                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptor;
