    1138                 :            : 
    1139                 :            : // Describes an individual service method.  To obtain a MethodDescriptor given
    1140                 :            : // a service, first get its ServiceDescriptor, then call
    1141                 :            : // ServiceDescriptor::FindMethodByName().  Use DescriptorPool to construct your
    1142                 :            : // own descriptors.
    1143                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT MethodDescriptor {
    1144                 :            :  public:
    1145                 :            :   // Name of this method, not including containing scope.
    1146                 :            :   const string& name() const;
    1147                 :            :   // The fully-qualified name of the method, scope delimited by periods.
    1148                 :            :   const string& full_name() const;
    1149                 :            :   // Index within the service's Descriptor.
    1150                 :            :   int index() const;
    1151                 :            : 
    1152                 :            :   // Gets the service to which this method belongs.  Never NULL.
    1153                 :            :   const ServiceDescriptor* service() const;
    1154                 :            : 
    1155                 :            :   // Gets the type of protocol message which this method accepts as input.
    1156                 :            :   const Descriptor* input_type() const;
    1157                 :            :   // Gets the type of protocol message which this message produces as output.
    1158                 :            :   const Descriptor* output_type() const;
    1159                 :            : 
    1160                 :            :   // Gets whether the client streams multiple requests.
    1161                 :            :   bool client_streaming() const;
    1162                 :            :   // Gets whether the server streams multiple responses.
    1163                 :            :   bool server_streaming() const;
    1164                 :            : 
    1165                 :            :   // Get options for this method.  These are specified in the .proto file by
    1166                 :            :   // placing lines like "option foo = 1234;" in curly-braces after a method
    1167                 :            :   // declaration.  Allowed options are defined by MethodOptions in
    1168                 :            :   // google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
    1169                 :            :   // message.
    1170                 :            :   const MethodOptions& options() const;
    1171                 :            : 
    1172                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
    1173                 :            :   void CopyTo(MethodDescriptorProto* proto) const;

    1175                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1176                 :            :   string DebugString() const;

    1179                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1180                 :            : 
    1181                 :            : 
    1182                 :            :   // Source Location ---------------------------------------------------

    1186                 :            :   // |*out_location| unchanged iff location information was not available.

    1210                 :            :   bool server_streaming_;

    1213                 :            :   // descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.

    1221                 :            : 
    1222                 :            : 
    1223                 :            : // Describes a whole .proto file.  To get the FileDescriptor for a compiled-in
    1224                 :            : // file, get the descriptor for something defined in that file and call
    1225                 :            : // descriptor->file().  Use DescriptorPool to construct your own descriptors.
    1226                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT FileDescriptor {
    1227                 :            :  public:
    1228                 :            :   // The filename, relative to the source tree.
    1229                 :            :   // e.g. "google/protobuf/descriptor.proto"
    1230                 :            :   const string& name() const;
    1231                 :            : 
    1232                 :            :   // The package, e.g. "google.protobuf.compiler".
    1233                 :            :   const string& package() const;
    1234                 :            : 
    1235                 :            :   // The DescriptorPool in which this FileDescriptor and all its contents were
    1236                 :            :   // allocated.  Never NULL.
    1237                 :            :   const DescriptorPool* pool() const;
    1238                 :            : 
    1239                 :            :   // The number of files imported by this one.
    1240                 :            :   int dependency_count() const;
    1241                 :            :   // Gets an imported file by index, where 0 <= index < dependency_count().
    1242                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1243                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* dependency(int index) const;
    1244                 :            : 
    1245                 :            :   // The number of files public imported by this one.
    1246                 :            :   // The public dependency list is a subset of the dependency list.
    1247                 :            :   int public_dependency_count() const;
    1248                 :            :   // Gets a public imported file by index, where 0 <= index <
    1249                 :            :   // public_dependency_count().
    1250                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1251                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* public_dependency(int index) const;
    1252                 :            : 
    1253                 :            :   // The number of files that are imported for weak fields.
    1254                 :            :   // The weak dependency list is a subset of the dependency list.
    1255                 :            :   int weak_dependency_count() const;
    1256                 :            :   // Gets a weak imported file by index, where 0 <= index <
    1257                 :            :   // weak_dependency_count().
    1258                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1259                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* weak_dependency(int index) const;
    1260                 :            : 
    1261                 :            :   // Number of top-level message types defined in this file.  (This does not
    1262                 :            :   // include nested types.)
    1263                 :            :   int message_type_count() const;
    1264                 :            :   // Gets a top-level message type, where 0 <= index < message_type_count().
    1265                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1266                 :            :   const Descriptor* message_type(int index) const;
    1267                 :            : 
    1268                 :            :   // Number of top-level enum types defined in this file.  (This does not
    1269                 :            :   // include nested types.)
    1270                 :            :   int enum_type_count() const;
    1271                 :            :   // Gets a top-level enum type, where 0 <= index < enum_type_count().
    1272                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1273                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* enum_type(int index) const;
    1274                 :            : 
    1275                 :            :   // Number of services defined in this file.
    1276                 :            :   int service_count() const;
    1277                 :            :   // Gets a service, where 0 <= index < service_count().
    1278                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1279                 :            :   const ServiceDescriptor* service(int index) const;
    1280                 :            : 
    1281                 :            :   // Number of extensions defined at file scope.  (This does not include
    1282                 :            :   // extensions nested within message types.)
    1283                 :            :   int extension_count() const;
    1284                 :            :   // Gets an extension's descriptor, where 0 <= index < extension_count().
    1285                 :            :   // These are returned in the order they were defined in the .proto file.
    1286                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* extension(int index) const;
    1287                 :            : 
    1288                 :            :   // Get options for this file.  These are specified in the .proto file by
    1289                 :            :   // placing lines like "option foo = 1234;" at the top level, outside of any
    1290                 :            :   // other definitions.  Allowed options are defined by FileOptions in
    1291                 :            :   // google/protobuf/descriptor.proto, and any available extensions of that
    1292                 :            :   // message.
    1293                 :            :   const FileOptions& options() const;
    1294                 :            : 
    1295                 :            :   // Syntax of this file.
    1296                 :            :   enum Syntax {
    1297                 :            :     SYNTAX_UNKNOWN = 0,
    1298                 :            :     SYNTAX_PROTO2  = 2,
    1299                 :            :     SYNTAX_PROTO3  = 3,
    1300                 :            :   };
    1301                 :            :   Syntax syntax() const;
    1302                 :            :   static const char* SyntaxName(Syntax syntax);
    1303                 :            : 
    1304                 :            :   // Find a top-level message type by name.  Returns NULL if not found.
    1305                 :            :   const Descriptor* FindMessageTypeByName(const string& name) const;
    1306                 :            :   // Find a top-level enum type by name.  Returns NULL if not found.
    1307                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* FindEnumTypeByName(const string& name) const;
    1308                 :            :   // Find an enum value defined in any top-level enum by name.  Returns NULL if
    1309                 :            :   // not found.
    1310                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* FindEnumValueByName(const string& name) const;
    1311                 :            :   // Find a service definition by name.  Returns NULL if not found.
    1312                 :            :   const ServiceDescriptor* FindServiceByName(const string& name) const;
    1313                 :            :   // Find a top-level extension definition by name.  Returns NULL if not found.
    1314                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByName(const string& name) const;
    1315                 :            :   // Similar to FindExtensionByName(), but searches by lowercased-name.  See
    1316                 :            :   // Descriptor::FindFieldByLowercaseName().

    1319                 :            :   // Descriptor::FindFieldByCamelcaseName().

    1321                 :            : 
    1322                 :            :   // See Descriptor::CopyTo().
    1323                 :            :   // Notes:
    1324                 :            :   // - This method does NOT copy source code information since it is relatively
    1325                 :            :   //   large and rarely needed.  See CopySourceCodeInfoTo() below.
    1326                 :            :   void CopyTo(FileDescriptorProto* proto) const;
    1327                 :            :   // Write the source code information of this FileDescriptor into the given
    1328                 :            :   // FileDescriptorProto.  See CopyTo() above.
    1329                 :            :   void CopySourceCodeInfoTo(FileDescriptorProto* proto) const;
    1330                 :            :   // Fill the json_name field of FieldDescriptorProto for all fields. Can only
    1331                 :            :   // be called after CopyTo().

    1333                 :            : 
    1334                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugString().
    1335                 :            :   string DebugString() const;
    1336                 :            : 
    1337                 :            :   // See Descriptor::DebugStringWithOptions().
    1338                 :            :   string DebugStringWithOptions(const DebugStringOptions& options) const;
    1339                 :            : 
    1340                 :            :   // Returns true if this is a placeholder for an unknown file. This will
    1341                 :            :   // only be the case if this descriptor comes from a DescriptorPool
    1342                 :            :   // with AllowUnknownDependencies() set.
    1343                 :            :   bool is_placeholder() const;
    1344                 :            : 
    1345                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete extent of
    1346                 :            :   // this file declaration (namely, the empty path).
    1347                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(SourceLocation* out_location) const;
    1348                 :            : 
    1349                 :            :   // Updates |*out_location| to the source location of the complete
    1350                 :            :   // extent of the declaration or declaration-part denoted by |path|.
    1351                 :            :   // Returns false and leaves |*out_location| unchanged iff location
    1352                 :            :   // information was not available.  (See SourceCodeInfo for
    1353                 :            :   // description of path encoding.)
    1354                 :            :   bool GetSourceLocation(const std::vector<int>& path,
    1355                 :            :                          SourceLocation* out_location) const;
    1356                 :            : 
    1357                 :            :  private:
    1358                 :            :   typedef FileOptions OptionsType;
    1359                 :            : 
    1360                 :            :   const string* name_;
    1361                 :            :   const string* package_;
    1362                 :            :   const DescriptorPool* pool_;
    1363                 :            :   int dependency_count_;
    1364                 :            :   mutable const FileDescriptor** dependencies_;
    1365                 :            :   const string** dependencies_names_;
    1366                 :            :   GoogleOnceDynamic* dependencies_once_;
    1367                 :            :   static void DependenciesOnceInit(const FileDescriptor* to_init);
    1368                 :            :   void InternalDependenciesOnceInit() const;
    1369                 :            :   int public_dependency_count_;
    1370                 :            :   int* public_dependencies_;
    1371                 :            :   int weak_dependency_count_;
    1372                 :            :   int* weak_dependencies_;
    1373                 :            :   int message_type_count_;
    1374                 :            :   Descriptor* message_types_;
    1375                 :            :   int enum_type_count_;
    1376                 :            :   EnumDescriptor* enum_types_;
    1377                 :            :   int service_count_;
    1378                 :            :   ServiceDescriptor* services_;
    1379                 :            :   int extension_count_;
    1380                 :            :   Syntax syntax_;
    1381                 :            :   bool is_placeholder_;
    1382                 :            :   FieldDescriptor* extensions_;
    1383                 :            :   const FileOptions* options_;
    1384                 :            : 
    1385                 :            :   const FileDescriptorTables* tables_;
    1386                 :            :   const SourceCodeInfo* source_code_info_;
    1387                 :            : 
    1388                 :            :   // Indicates the FileDescriptor is completed building. Used to verify
    1389                 :            :   // that type accessor functions that can possibly build a dependent file
    1390                 :            :   // aren't called during the process of building the file.
    1391                 :            :   bool finished_building_;
    1392                 :            : 
    1393                 :            :   // IMPORTANT:  If you add a new field, make sure to search for all instances
    1394                 :            :   // of Allocate<FileDescriptor>() and AllocateArray<FileDescriptor>() in
    1395                 :            :   // descriptor.cc and update them to initialize the field.
    1396                 :            : 
    1397                 :            :   FileDescriptor() {}
    1398                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
    1399                 :            :   friend class DescriptorPool;
    1400                 :            :   friend class Descriptor;
    1401                 :            :   friend class FieldDescriptor;
    1402                 :            :   friend class internal::LazyDescriptor;
    1403                 :            :   friend class OneofDescriptor;
    1404                 :            :   friend class EnumDescriptor;
    1405                 :            :   friend class EnumValueDescriptor;
    1406                 :            :   friend class MethodDescriptor;
    1407                 :            :   friend class ServiceDescriptor;
    1408                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(FileDescriptor);
    1409                 :            : };
    1410                 :            : 
    1411                 :            : // ===================================================================
    1412                 :            : 
    1413                 :            : // Used to construct descriptors.
    1414                 :            : //
    1415                 :            : // Normally you won't want to build your own descriptors.  Message classes
    1416                 :            : // constructed by the protocol compiler will provide them for you.  However,
    1417                 :            : // if you are implementing Message on your own, or if you are writing a
    1418                 :            : // program which can operate on totally arbitrary types and needs to load
    1419                 :            : // them from some sort of database, you might need to.
    1420                 :            : //
    1421                 :            : // Since Descriptors are composed of a whole lot of cross-linked bits of
    1422                 :            : // data that would be a pain to put together manually, the
    1423                 :            : // DescriptorPool class is provided to make the process easier.  It can
    1424                 :            : // take a FileDescriptorProto (defined in descriptor.proto), validate it,
    1425                 :            : // and convert it to a set of nicely cross-linked Descriptors.
    1426                 :            : //
    1427                 :            : // DescriptorPool also helps with memory management.  Descriptors are
    1428                 :            : // composed of many objects containing static data and pointers to each
    1429                 :            : // other.  In all likelihood, when it comes time to delete this data,
    1430                 :            : // you'll want to delete it all at once.  In fact, it is not uncommon to
    1431                 :            : // have a whole pool of descriptors all cross-linked with each other which
    1432                 :            : // you wish to delete all at once.  This class represents such a pool, and
    1433                 :            : // handles the memory management for you.
    1434                 :            : //
    1435                 :            : // You can also search for descriptors within a DescriptorPool by name, and
    1436                 :            : // extensions by number.
    1437                 :            : class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT DescriptorPool {
    1438                 :            :  public:
    1439                 :            :   // Create a normal, empty DescriptorPool.
    1440                 :            :   DescriptorPool();
    1441                 :            : 
    1442                 :            :   // Constructs a DescriptorPool that, when it can't find something among the
    1443                 :            :   // descriptors already in the pool, looks for it in the given
    1444                 :            :   // DescriptorDatabase.
    1445                 :            :   // Notes:
    1446                 :            :   // - If a DescriptorPool is constructed this way, its BuildFile*() methods
    1447                 :            :   //   must not be called (they will assert-fail).  The only way to populate
    1448                 :            :   //   the pool with descriptors is to call the Find*By*() methods.
    1449                 :            :   // - The Find*By*() methods may block the calling thread if the
    1450                 :            :   //   DescriptorDatabase blocks.  This in turn means that parsing messages
    1451                 :            :   //   may block if they need to look up extensions.
    1452                 :            :   // - The Find*By*() methods will use mutexes for thread-safety, thus making
    1453                 :            :   //   them slower even when they don't have to fall back to the database.
    1454                 :            :   //   In fact, even the Find*By*() methods of descriptor objects owned by
    1455                 :            :   //   this pool will be slower, since they will have to obtain locks too.
    1456                 :            :   // - An ErrorCollector may optionally be given to collect validation errors
    1457                 :            :   //   in files loaded from the database.  If not given, errors will be printed
    1458                 :            :   //   to GOOGLE_LOG(ERROR).  Remember that files are built on-demand, so this
    1459                 :            :   //   ErrorCollector may be called from any thread that calls one of the
    1460                 :            :   //   Find*By*() methods.
    1461                 :            :   // - The DescriptorDatabase must not be mutated during the lifetime of
    1462                 :            :   //   the DescriptorPool. Even if the client takes care to avoid data races,
    1463                 :            :   //   changes to the content of the DescriptorDatabase may not be reflected
    1464                 :            :   //   in subsequent lookups in the DescriptorPool.
    1465                 :            :   class ErrorCollector;
    1466                 :            :   explicit DescriptorPool(DescriptorDatabase* fallback_database,
    1467                 :            :                           ErrorCollector* error_collector = NULL);
    1468                 :            : 
    1469                 :            :   ~DescriptorPool();
    1470                 :            : 
    1471                 :            :   // Get a pointer to the generated pool.  Generated protocol message classes
    1472                 :            :   // which are compiled into the binary will allocate their descriptors in
    1473                 :            :   // this pool.  Do not add your own descriptors to this pool.
    1474                 :            :   static const DescriptorPool* generated_pool();
    1475                 :            : 
    1476                 :            : 
    1477                 :            :   // Find a FileDescriptor in the pool by file name.  Returns NULL if not
    1478                 :            :   // found.
    1479                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* FindFileByName(const string& name) const;
    1480                 :            : 
    1481                 :            :   // Find the FileDescriptor in the pool which defines the given symbol.
    1482                 :            :   // If any of the Find*ByName() methods below would succeed, then this is
    1483                 :            :   // equivalent to calling that method and calling the result's file() method.
    1484                 :            :   // Otherwise this returns NULL.
    1485                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* FindFileContainingSymbol(
    1486                 :            :       const string& symbol_name) const;
    1487                 :            : 
    1488                 :            :   // Looking up descriptors ------------------------------------------
    1489                 :            :   // These find descriptors by fully-qualified name.  These will find both
    1490                 :            :   // top-level descriptors and nested descriptors.  They return NULL if not
    1491                 :            :   // found.
    1492                 :            : 
    1493                 :            :   const Descriptor* FindMessageTypeByName(const string& name) const;
    1494                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindFieldByName(const string& name) const;
    1495                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByName(const string& name) const;
    1496                 :            :   const OneofDescriptor* FindOneofByName(const string& name) const;
    1497                 :            :   const EnumDescriptor* FindEnumTypeByName(const string& name) const;
    1498                 :            :   const EnumValueDescriptor* FindEnumValueByName(const string& name) const;
    1499                 :            :   const ServiceDescriptor* FindServiceByName(const string& name) const;
    1500                 :            :   const MethodDescriptor* FindMethodByName(const string& name) const;
    1501                 :            : 
    1502                 :            :   // Finds an extension of the given type by number.  The extendee must be
    1503                 :            :   // a member of this DescriptorPool or one of its underlays.
    1504                 :            :   const FieldDescriptor* FindExtensionByNumber(const Descriptor* extendee,
    1505                 :            :                                                int number) const;
    1506                 :            : 
    1507                 :            :   // Finds extensions of extendee. The extensions will be appended to
    1508                 :            :   // out in an undefined order. Only extensions defined directly in
    1509                 :            :   // this DescriptorPool or one of its underlays are guaranteed to be
    1510                 :            :   // found: extensions defined in the fallback database might not be found
    1511                 :            :   // depending on the database implementation.
    1512                 :            :   void FindAllExtensions(const Descriptor* extendee,
    1513                 :            :                          std::vector<const FieldDescriptor*>* out) const;
    1514                 :            : 
    1515                 :            :   // Building descriptors --------------------------------------------
    1516                 :            : 
    1517                 :            :   // When converting a FileDescriptorProto to a FileDescriptor, various
    1518                 :            :   // errors might be detected in the input.  The caller may handle these
    1519                 :            :   // programmatically by implementing an ErrorCollector.
    1520                 :            :   class LIBPROTOBUF_EXPORT ErrorCollector {
    1521                 :            :    public:
    1522                 :          0 :     inline ErrorCollector() {}
    1523                 :            :     virtual ~ErrorCollector();
    1524                 :            : 
    1525                 :            :     // These constants specify what exact part of the construct is broken.
    1526                 :            :     // This is useful e.g. for mapping the error back to an exact location
    1527                 :            :     // in a .proto file.
    1528                 :            :     enum ErrorLocation {
    1529                 :            :       NAME,              // the symbol name, or the package name for files
    1530                 :            :       NUMBER,            // field or extension range number
    1531                 :            :       TYPE,              // field type
    1532                 :            :       EXTENDEE,          // field extendee
    1533                 :            :       DEFAULT_VALUE,     // field default value
    1534                 :            :       INPUT_TYPE,        // method input type
    1535                 :            :       OUTPUT_TYPE,       // method output type
    1536                 :            :       OPTION_NAME,       // name in assignment
    1537                 :            :       OPTION_VALUE,      // value in option assignment
    1538                 :            :       OTHER              // some other problem
    1539                 :            :     };
    1540                 :            : 
    1541                 :            :     // Reports an error in the FileDescriptorProto. Use this function if the
    1542                 :            :     // problem occurred should interrupt building the FileDescriptorProto.
    1543                 :            :     virtual void AddError(
    1544                 :            :       const string& filename,      // File name in which the error occurred.
    1545                 :            :       const string& element_name,  // Full name of the erroneous element.
    1546                 :            :       const Message* descriptor,   // Descriptor of the erroneous element.
    1547                 :            :       ErrorLocation location,      // One of the location constants, above.
    1548                 :            :       const string& message        // Human-readable error message.
    1549                 :            :       ) = 0;
    1550                 :            : 
    1551                 :            :     // Reports a warning in the FileDescriptorProto. Use this function if the
    1552                 :            :     // problem occurred should NOT interrupt building the FileDescriptorProto.
    1553                 :            :     virtual void AddWarning(
    1554                 :            :       const string& /*filename*/,      // File name in which the error occurred.
    1555                 :            :       const string& /*element_name*/,  // Full name of the erroneous element.
    1556                 :            :       const Message* /*descriptor*/,   // Descriptor of the erroneous element.
    1557                 :            :       ErrorLocation /*location*/,      // One of the location constants, above.
    1558                 :            :       const string& /*message*/        // Human-readable error message.
    1559                 :            :       ) {}
    1560                 :            : 
    1561                 :            :    private:
    1562                 :            :     GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(ErrorCollector);
    1563                 :            :   };
    1564                 :            : 
    1565                 :            :   // Convert the FileDescriptorProto to real descriptors and place them in
    1566                 :            :   // this DescriptorPool.  All dependencies of the file must already be in
    1567                 :            :   // the pool.  Returns the resulting FileDescriptor, or NULL if there were
    1568                 :            :   // problems with the input (e.g. the message was invalid, or dependencies
    1569                 :            :   // were missing).  Details about the errors are written to GOOGLE_LOG(ERROR).
    1570                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* BuildFile(const FileDescriptorProto& proto);
    1571                 :            : 
    1572                 :            :   // Same as BuildFile() except errors are sent to the given ErrorCollector.
    1573                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* BuildFileCollectingErrors(
    1574                 :            :     const FileDescriptorProto& proto,
    1575                 :            :     ErrorCollector* error_collector);
    1576                 :            : 
    1577                 :            :   // By default, it is an error if a FileDescriptorProto contains references
    1578                 :            :   // to types or other files that are not found in the DescriptorPool (or its
    1579                 :            :   // backing DescriptorDatabase, if any).  If you call
    1580                 :            :   // AllowUnknownDependencies(), however, then unknown types and files
    1581                 :            :   // will be replaced by placeholder descriptors (which can be identified by
    1582                 :            :   // the is_placeholder() method).  This can allow you to
    1583                 :            :   // perform some useful operations with a .proto file even if you do not
    1584                 :            :   // have access to other .proto files on which it depends.  However, some
    1585                 :            :   // heuristics must be used to fill in the gaps in information, and these
    1586                 :            :   // can lead to descriptors which are inaccurate.  For example, the
    1587                 :            :   // DescriptorPool may be forced to guess whether an unknown type is a message
    1588                 :            :   // or an enum, as well as what package it resides in.  Furthermore,
    1589                 :            :   // placeholder types will not be discoverable via FindMessageTypeByName()
    1590                 :            :   // and similar methods, which could confuse some descriptor-based algorithms.
    1591                 :            :   // Generally, the results of this option should be handled with extreme care.
    1592                 :            :   void AllowUnknownDependencies() { allow_unknown_ = true; }
    1593                 :            : 
    1594                 :            :   // By default, weak imports are allowed to be missing, in which case we will
    1595                 :            :   // use a placeholder for the dependency and convert the field to be an Empty
    1596                 :            :   // message field. If you call EnforceWeakDependencies(true), however, the
    1597                 :            :   // DescriptorPool will report a import not found error.
    1598                 :            :   void EnforceWeakDependencies(bool enforce) { enforce_weak_ = enforce; }
    1599                 :            : 
    1600                 :            :   // Internal stuff --------------------------------------------------
    1601                 :            :   // These methods MUST NOT be called from outside the proto2 library.
    1602                 :            :   // These methods may contain hidden pitfalls and may be removed in a
    1603                 :            :   // future library version.
    1604                 :            : 
    1605                 :            :   // Create a DescriptorPool which is overlaid on top of some other pool.
    1606                 :            :   // If you search for a descriptor in the overlay and it is not found, the
    1607                 :            :   // underlay will be searched as a backup.  If the underlay has its own
    1608                 :            :   // underlay, that will be searched next, and so on.  This also means that
    1609                 :            :   // files built in the overlay will be cross-linked with the underlay's
    1610                 :            :   // descriptors if necessary.  The underlay remains property of the caller;
    1611                 :            :   // it must remain valid for the lifetime of the newly-constructed pool.
    1612                 :            :   //
    1613                 :            :   // Example:  Say you want to parse a .proto file at runtime in order to use
    1614                 :            :   // its type with a DynamicMessage.  Say this .proto file has dependencies,
    1615                 :            :   // but you know that all the dependencies will be things that are already
    1616                 :            :   // compiled into the binary.  For ease of use, you'd like to load the types
    1617                 :            :   // right out of generated_pool() rather than have to parse redundant copies
    1618                 :            :   // of all these .protos and runtime.  But, you don't want to add the parsed
    1619                 :            :   // types directly into generated_pool(): this is not allowed, and would be
    1620                 :            :   // bad design anyway.  So, instead, you could use generated_pool() as an
    1621                 :            :   // underlay for a new DescriptorPool in which you add only the new file.
    1622                 :            :   //
    1623                 :            :   // WARNING:  Use of underlays can lead to many subtle gotchas.  Instead,
    1624                 :            :   //   try to formulate what you want to do in terms of DescriptorDatabases.
    1625                 :            :   explicit DescriptorPool(const DescriptorPool* underlay);
    1626                 :            : 
    1627                 :            :   // Called by generated classes at init time to add their descriptors to
    1628                 :            :   // generated_pool.  Do NOT call this in your own code!  filename must be a
    1629                 :            :   // permanent string (e.g. a string literal).
    1630                 :            :   static void InternalAddGeneratedFile(
    1631                 :            :       const void* encoded_file_descriptor, int size);
    1632                 :            : 
    1633                 :            :   // Disallow [enforce_utf8 = false] in .proto files.
    1634                 :            :   void DisallowEnforceUtf8() { disallow_enforce_utf8_ = true; }
    1635                 :            : 
    1636                 :            : 
    1637                 :            :   // For internal use only:  Gets a non-const pointer to the generated pool.
    1638                 :            :   // This is called at static-initialization time only, so thread-safety is
    1639                 :            :   // not a concern.  If both an underlay and a fallback database are present,
    1640                 :            :   // the underlay takes precedence.
    1641                 :            :   static DescriptorPool* internal_generated_pool();
    1642                 :            : 
    1643                 :            :   // For internal use only:  Changes the behavior of BuildFile() such that it
    1644                 :            :   // allows the file to make reference to message types declared in other files
    1645                 :            :   // which it did not officially declare as dependencies.
    1646                 :            :   void InternalDontEnforceDependencies();
    1647                 :            : 
    1648                 :            :   // For internal use only: Enables lazy building of dependencies of a file.
    1649                 :            :   // Delay the building of dependencies of a file descriptor until absolutely
    1650                 :            :   // necessary, like when message_type() is called on a field that is defined
    1651                 :            :   // in that dependency's file. This will cause functional issues if a proto
    1652                 :            :   // or one of it's dependencies has errors. Should only be enabled for the
    1653                 :            :   // generated_pool_ (because no descriptor build errors are guaranteed by
    1654                 :            :   // the compilation generation process), testing, or if a lack of descriptor
    1655                 :            :   // build errors can be guaranteed for a pool.
    1656                 :            :   void InternalSetLazilyBuildDependencies() {
    1657                 :            :     lazily_build_dependencies_ = true;
    1658                 :            :     // This needs to be set when lazily building dependencies, as it breaks
    1659                 :            :     // dependency checking.
    1660                 :            :     InternalDontEnforceDependencies();
    1661                 :            :   }
    1662                 :            : 
    1663                 :            :   // For internal use only.
    1664                 :            :   void internal_set_underlay(const DescriptorPool* underlay) {
    1665                 :            :     underlay_ = underlay;
    1666                 :            :   }
    1667                 :            : 
    1668                 :            :   // For internal (unit test) use only:  Returns true if a FileDescriptor has
    1669                 :            :   // been constructed for the given file, false otherwise.  Useful for testing
    1670                 :            :   // lazy descriptor initialization behavior.
    1671                 :            :   bool InternalIsFileLoaded(const string& filename) const;
    1672                 :            : 
    1673                 :            : 
    1674                 :            :   // Add a file to unused_import_track_files_. DescriptorBuilder will log
    1675                 :            :   // warnings for those files if there is any unused import.
    1676                 :            :   void AddUnusedImportTrackFile(const string& file_name);
    1677                 :            :   void ClearUnusedImportTrackFiles();
    1678                 :            : 
    1679                 :            :  private:
    1680                 :            :   friend class Descriptor;
    1681                 :            :   friend class internal::LazyDescriptor;
    1682                 :            :   friend class FieldDescriptor;
    1683                 :            :   friend class EnumDescriptor;
    1684                 :            :   friend class ServiceDescriptor;
    1685                 :            :   friend class MethodDescriptor;
    1686                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptor;
    1687                 :            :   friend class StreamDescriptor;
    1688                 :            :   friend class DescriptorBuilder;
    1689                 :            :   friend class FileDescriptorTables;
    1690                 :            : 
    1691                 :            :   // Return true if the given name is a sub-symbol of any non-package
    1692                 :            :   // descriptor that already exists in the descriptor pool.  (The full
    1693                 :            :   // definition of such types is already known.)
    1694                 :            :   bool IsSubSymbolOfBuiltType(const string& name) const;
    1695                 :            : 
    1696                 :            :   // Tries to find something in the fallback database and link in the
    1697                 :            :   // corresponding proto file.  Returns true if successful, in which case
    1698                 :            :   // the caller should search for the thing again.  These are declared
    1699                 :            :   // const because they are called by (semantically) const methods.
    1700                 :            :   bool TryFindFileInFallbackDatabase(const string& name) const;
    1701                 :            :   bool TryFindSymbolInFallbackDatabase(const string& name) const;
    1702                 :            :   bool TryFindExtensionInFallbackDatabase(const Descriptor* containing_type,
    1703                 :            :                                           int field_number) const;
    1704                 :            : 
    1705                 :            :   // Like BuildFile() but called internally when the file has been loaded from
    1706                 :            :   // fallback_database_.  Declared const because it is called by (semantically)
    1707                 :            :   // const methods.
    1708                 :            :   const FileDescriptor* BuildFileFromDatabase(
    1709                 :            :     const FileDescriptorProto& proto) const;
    1710                 :            : 
    1711                 :            :   // Helper for when lazily_build_dependencies_ is set, can look up a symbol
    1712                 :            :   // after the file's descriptor is built, and can build the file where that
    1713                 :            :   // symbol is defined if necessary. Will create a placeholder if the type
    1714                 :            :   // doesn't exist in the fallback database, or the file doesn't build
    1715                 :            :   // successfully.
    1716                 :            :   Symbol CrossLinkOnDemandHelper(const string& name, bool expecting_enum) const;
    1717                 :            : 
    1718                 :            :   // Create a placeholder FileDescriptor of the specified name
    1719                 :            :   FileDescriptor* NewPlaceholderFile(const string& name) const;
    1720                 :            :   FileDescriptor* NewPlaceholderFileWithMutexHeld(const string& name) const;
    1721                 :            : 
    1722                 :            :   enum PlaceholderType {
    1723                 :            :     PLACEHOLDER_MESSAGE,
    1724                 :            :     PLACEHOLDER_ENUM,
    1725                 :            :     PLACEHOLDER_EXTENDABLE_MESSAGE
    1726                 :            :   };
    1727                 :            :   // Create a placeholder Descriptor of the specified name
    1728                 :            :   Symbol NewPlaceholder(const string& name,
    1729                 :            :                         PlaceholderType placeholder_type) const;
    1730                 :            :   Symbol NewPlaceholderWithMutexHeld(const string& name,
    1731                 :            :                                      PlaceholderType placeholder_type) const;
    1732                 :            : 
    1733                 :            :   // If fallback_database_ is NULL, this is NULL.  Otherwise, this is a mutex
    1734                 :            :   // which must be locked while accessing tables_.
    1735                 :            :   Mutex* mutex_;
    1736                 :            : 
    1737                 :            :   // See constructor.
    1738                 :            :   DescriptorDatabase* fallback_database_;
    1739                 :            :   ErrorCollector* default_error_collector_;
    1740                 :            :   const DescriptorPool* underlay_;
    1741                 :            : 
    1742                 :            :   // This class contains a lot of hash maps with complicated types that
    1743                 :            :   // we'd like to keep out of the header.
    1744                 :            :   class Tables;
    1745                 :            :   google::protobuf::scoped_ptr<Tables> tables_;
    1746                 :            : 
    1747                 :            :   bool enforce_dependencies_;
    1748                 :            :   bool lazily_build_dependencies_;
    1749                 :            :   bool allow_unknown_;
    1750                 :            :   bool enforce_weak_;
    1751                 :            :   std::set<string> unused_import_track_files_;
    1752                 :            :   bool disallow_enforce_utf8_;
    1753                 :            : 
    1754                 :            :   GOOGLE_DISALLOW_EVIL_CONSTRUCTORS(DescriptorPool);
    1755                 :            : };
    1756                 :            : 
    1757                 :            : // inline methods ====================================================
    1758                 :            : 
    1759                 :            : // These macros makes this repetitive code more readable.
    1760                 :            : #define PROTOBUF_DEFINE_ACCESSOR(CLASS, FIELD, TYPE) \
    1761                 :            :   inline TYPE CLASS::FIELD() const { return FIELD##_; }
    1762                 :            : 
    1763                 :            : // Strings fields are stored as pointers but returned as const references.
    1764                 :            : #define PROTOBUF_DEFINE_STRING_ACCESSOR(CLASS, FIELD) \
    1765                 :            :   inline const string& CLASS::FIELD() const { return *FIELD##_; }
    1766                 :            : 
    1767                 :            : // Arrays take an index parameter, obviously.
    1768                 :            : #define PROTOBUF_DEFINE_ARRAY_ACCESSOR(CLASS, FIELD, TYPE) \
    1769                 :            :   inline TYPE CLASS::FIELD(int index) const { return FIELD##s_ + index; }
    1770                 :            : 
    1771                 :            : #define PROTOBUF_DEFINE_OPTIONS_ACCESSOR(CLASS, TYPE) \
    1772                 :            :   inline const TYPE& CLASS::options() const { return *options_; }
